      • fft_c

        public static double[] fft_c(double[] real_signal)
        Computes the FFT of a real signal
        Parameters:
        real_signal - the real signal sequence
        Returns:
        DFT coefficients or null if signal's length is not a power of 2

      • silence_detector

        public static double[] silence_detector(double[] signal,
                                        int FS,
                                        double win1,
                                        double wins)
        Detect the signal endpoints
        Parameters:
        signal - signal data
        FS - sampling frequency in Hz
        win1 - window size in seconds
        wins - window shift in seconds
        Returns:
        [B,E] (B = beginning, E = end) indices

                                    int end,
                                    int step)
        Create an evenly-spaced sequence of numbers
        Parameters:
        start - starting index
        end - largest reachable index
        step - increment step size
        Returns:
        resulting sequence
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - start index must be larger than start index

      • create_range

        public static double[] create_range(int start,
                                    int end)
        Create a 1-incremented sequence
        Parameters:
        start - starting index
        end - largest reachable index
        Returns:
        resulting sequence
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - start index must be larger than start index

      • dtw_distance

        public static double dtw_distance(Matrix B,
                                  Matrix Ref)
        Computes the Dynamic Time Warping cost between the m-dimensional sequence B and the reference Ref
        Parameters:
        Ref - reference feature sequence as a Matrix
        B - test feature sequence as a Matrix
        Returns:
        normalized matching cost
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - Cannot warp null matrices
        java.lang.RuntimeException - Matrices must have the same row count

      • dtw_distance

        public static double dtw_distance(double[][] B,
                                  double[][] Ref)
        Computes the Dynamic Time Warping cost between the m-dimensional sequence B and the reference Ref
        Parameters:
        Ref - reference feature sequence as a 2-D array
        B - test feature sequence as a 2-D array
        Returns:
        normalized matching cost
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - Cannot warp null matrices
        java.lang.RuntimeException - Matrices must have the same row count

      • dtw_distance

        public static double dtw_distance(Matrix B,
                                  Matrix Ref,
                                  boolean to_norm)
        Computes the Dynamic Time Warping cost between the m-dimensional sequence B and the reference Ref
        Parameters:
        Ref - reference feature sequence as a Matrix
        B - test feature sequence as a Matrix
        to_norm - specifies whether to normalize the cost or not
        Returns:
        matching cost (normalized if to_norm is true)
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - Cannot warp null matrices
        java.lang.RuntimeException - Matrices must have the same row count

      • dtw

        public static Matrix[] dtw(Matrix B,
                           Matrix Ref,
                           boolean to_norm)
        Computes the Dynamic Time Warping cost between the m-dimensional sequence B and the reference Ref and the best path after backtracking
        Parameters:
        Ref - reference feature sequence as a Matrix
        B - test feature sequence as a Matrix
        to_norm - specifies whether to normalize the cost or not
        Returns:
        matching cost as the first 1-element matrix and the best path as the second Matrix.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - Cannot warp null matrices
        java.lang.RuntimeException - Matrices must have the same row count

      • zero_padding

        public static double[] zero_padding(double[] signal,
                                    int result_size)
        Pad zeros to the end of the signal to make its size equal to the result_size
        Parameters:
        signal - the source signal to zero-pad
        result_size - the size of the signal after zero-padding
        Returns:
        zero-padded signal
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - signal cannot be null
